qas.question: Along with the Anglican Church and Uniting Church, what religious denomination operates private schools in Australia?
What denomination operates St Joseph's College?
Where is St Aloysius' College located?
What denomination insists that students must also be a member of the founding church?
What category do all Catholic schools fall into?
Where is St. Gregory's College located?

plausible_answers.text: Anglican Church, Uniting Church and Presbyterian Church

qas.question: What three churches have colleges in Sydney?
What do all grammar schools insist their students have in order to attend?

context: Although most are non-aligned, some of the best known independent schools also belong to the large, long-established religious foundations, such as the <b4_0><b7_0>Anglican Church<b4_0/>, Uniting Church and <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2>Presbyterian<a0_0/> Church<b7_0/><a0_2/><a0_1/>, but in most cases, they do not insist on their students’ <b8_0>religious allegiance<b8_0/>. These schools are typically viewed as <b5_0>'elite schools'<b5_0/>. Many of the 'grammar schools' also fall in this category. They are usually expensive schools that tend to be up-market and traditional in style, some <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2>Catholic<a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/> schools fall into this category as well, e.g. St Joseph's College, Gregory Terrace, Saint Ignatius' College, Riverview, St Gregory's College, Campbelltown, St Aloysius' College <b6_0>(<a2_0><a2_1><a2_2>Sydney<a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/>)<b6_0/> and St Joseph's College, Hunters Hill, as well as Loreto Kirribilli, Monte Sant Angelo Mercy College, St Ursula's College and Loreto Normanhurst for <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2>girls<a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/>.
